title: Having issues Patching 7.3? Click Here!
body:
Hey everyone,

New Heartseeker skins?  Subtle hints from our significant others about 'reservations'?  Mad googling for gifts?  This patch is definitely going to be during either the most loved or hated of holidays, Valentines Day:

http://i.imgur.com/aGL0By1.jpg

Get back to making sweaty, hot, passionate clicking with League by following our tantalizing guide if you aren't able to patch properly!

--------------------------------------------------------------

#***Updated Client (Beta Client)***

>*** Error: "League of Legends has encountered a problem. Please re-install League alpha client or try again."***

This issue rears its ugly head if something went wrong in either the updating or the installation process of the Client Update. The solution is to complete a full and clean reinstallation of League by following [**this guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202539040-Reinstalling-League-of-Legends) to a T.

>***My IP Balance in the Store is incorrect***

There have been some issues with the client pulling correct IP balances. Some players have been able to resolve this by launching into the Legacy Client and making a single purchase to resolve this. If this does not work, hit us up in a [**support ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) and we'll work together to resolve this.

>***Weird or corrupt formatting on login screen for Mac players***

If you're running Lion or an older operating system version then you may run into these weird visual problems.  Updating your OSX to a more recent version or Sierra should resolve this.

You can update your OS version to the latest available from Apple to resolve this problem:

* Click the Apple icon on the top left of the screen, and choose "Software Update..."
* The App store will open and display any software updates available for OS X and the App Store. OS X updates will be at the top of the list.
* Click "Update All" to install all available software updates. If prompted, enter an admin name and password, then your Apple ID and password
* If required, restart your system

--------------------------------------------------------------

#***Legacy Client***

>***Files Scanned reaches over 9000!!!!! Or, 15k, 20k, etc***

The patcher needs to scan already installed files to make sure that none of the files are corrupt.  If it finds one, it replaces it and rescans the files.  This is why it can sometimes get as high as 20k, even though there aren't 20k files in the installation.  

**The best thing to do is let it scan files!**  If you restart the client, it may cause it to scan even more files.   The patcher will eventually stop scanning files, and it will patch normally afterward.

>***Patcher stops/errors out at 33%, Patcher fails at 99%, or a general "Unspecified Error has occurred" message***

These are usually connection related errors. Either your computer is unable to maintain a stable connection, or a 3rd party security program is blocking League of Legends from properly patching. To get these issues resolved ASAP, make sure to go through our [Connection Issues Guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues)!

It sounds like you've already worked through our connection guide in its entirety. The errors you're running into definitely throw up a red flag about an *unstable connection* to our servers. I strongly recommend running a traceroute so we can get a better understanding of what's going on between you and the servers. I recommend using [**WinMTR**](http://winmtr.net/) to grab this log. After loading up the app, simply plug **104.160.131.1** into the host field and start the trace. After 5 minutes has gone by, export your results as text and paste them in a reply.

Let me know if you run into any issues with this.

**Lag Spikes in 7.3**


-Windows 10 User
-Beta client
-Completed connection troubleshooting page (despite never having issues in the 2+ years I've been playing)

Ever since I installed the 7.3 patch, I have been experiencing massive in-game lag spikes. My MS prior to the patch always hovered around 30 +/- 5. In every game mode I now experience spikes up to 600 roughly every few min, but especially when there is a lot of "action" happening in the play. This was confirmed in my game logs after I used the Hextech tool provided on the connection support page. I have not changed any local settings on my pc, or network connection. The only thing that has changed is the patch. Anecdotally I have seen other players note a similar experience in game. Is this a known issue?

So basically my issue is that my FPS randomly drops for a second. For example if I have my fps capped at 144 sometimes it will randomly drop to 94 which is a noticeable drop. I can usually get it to happen when walking into the blue buff area but it still happens elsewhere and too randomly for me to really put a pattern on it. Most of the time in game my fps is fine however, just these random drops.

Specs:
i7 6700k

gtx 1080

Win 10

Do these drops happen if you don't cap your framerate to 144? If that doesn't cause a change, then your framerate issues are likely the result of certain windows power settings or a bad driver installation. I'd recommend working through our [**FPS troubleshooting Guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting) in order to ensure those common culprits aren't causing issues here.

Let me know if this was unable to resolve the issue.

They happen no matter what frame rate i cap at. If I cap at 80 it will drop to 60, if I cap at 60 it will drop to 50 all for a split second and then return to normal. Also I have tried updating my drivers and doing a clean installation as well as trying the things suggested in your FPS troubleshooting guide. I've also tried setting the power option to high performance mode for my cpu and changing my graphics cards setting to prefer maximum performance as well as lowering all settings in league, yet the drops still happen regardless. They aren't consistent enough to make the game unplayable but I know they shouldn't be happening. Usually I can get the drop to happen if I walk into blue buff for the first time after it's spawned and when I turn the corner and as soon as I get vision of blue buff and that part of the jungle the fps usually drops but not always. Or sometimes if I see a champion for the first time even it might drop. Someone suggested something about a problem loading resources but I am not entirely sure.

Since you're still experiencing issues after working through that guide, I'd like to escalate this to our tech team for further troubleshooting. I recommend running some system logs with our [**HRT App**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367), then attach them to a [**support ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) so we can get back to you.

Let me know if you run into any issues.

Additionally, if you're playing during off-peak hours, it could increase queue times for matches. You may want to switch up the hours that your play on the PBE in order to see healthier queue times.
